An integer `n` is even if and only if `n` modulo 2 equals 0.

statement: theorem Int.even_iff : ∀ {n : ℤ}, Even n ↔ n % 2 = 0 := by sorry
name: Int.even_iff
description: This theorem states that for any integer `n`, `n` is even if and only if `n` modulo 2 equals 0. In other words, an integer `n` satisfies the property `Even`--meaning there exists some other integer `r` such that `n = r + r`--if and only if the remainder when `n` is divided by 2 is 0. This is a formalization of the usual mathematical definition of even numbers in the integers.
concise-description: An integer `n` is even if and only if `n` modulo 2 equals 0.
